segments.text: I keep glancing out the window above the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful and orderly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's a neat path and well-maintained bushes, everything just so.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It provides such a stark contrast to the unfolding chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's as if two different worlds are coexisting in the same frame.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Inside, water is flooding the floor and children are risking a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the sun is shining, and everything is calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's quite a clever way to highlight the domestic drama.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window acts like a frame for a completely different reality.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a sense of calm just looking at the garden view.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then my eyes return to the rising water level inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a powerful visual metaphor, isn't it?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This juxtaposition makes the whole scene more impactful.
segments.speaker: PAR
